required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pilot Study: Safety of a Customized MRI System for Neonatal Imaging
clinical_study.official_title: Pilot Study: Safety of a Customized MRI System for Neonatal Imaging

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the safety of a customized MRI scanner and gather preliminary data on image quality in a group of 10 medically stable infants admitted to the Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (NICU) at Cincinnati Children's Hospital Medical Center (CCHMC).

detailed_description.textblock: The current practice of transferring infants from the Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (NICU) to radiology departments and imaging in adult-sized magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) scanners is associated with significant safety and image quality issues. For these reasons, the potential of MRI for diagnosing disease in neonates has yet to be fully realized. The overreaching goal of our research effort is to bring high-performance MRI into the NICU so that neonates can benefit from the same quality of diagnostic imaging as adults. To accomplish this we have converted a commercial small-bore 1.5 Tesla (T) MRI scanner designed for orthopedic use into a neonatal MRI system optimized for whole body imaging of neonates. The purpose of this initial study is to determine the safety of the customized scanner installed in the NICU at Cincinnati Children's Hospital Medical Center (CCHMC) and gather preliminary data on image quality in a group of 10 medically stable infants admitted to the CCHMC NICU.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events as Measured by Vital Signs, Change in Temperature, and Physical Exam
primary_outcome.description: Heart rate and oxygen saturation will be measured every 15+/- 5 minutes. The infants' temperatures will be taken immediately before the MRI and again immediately after the MRI. A physical exam will be performed both immediately before and immediately after the MRI to assess for any physical changes.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post MRI Scan for Each Infant
secondary_outcome.description: The following measures will be individually evaluated and compared to similar images previously acquired on an adult scanner: Overall Study Quality, Motion, Spatial Resolution, Signal to Noise, and Contrast.

clinical_study.condition: Safety of a Customized NICU MRI System

arm_group.arm_group_label: Safety of a Customized NICU MRI System
arm_group.description: Device: GE OPTIMA MR430s with HDX/GE Electronics

intervention.intervention_name: GE OPTIMA MR430s with HDX/GE Electronics
intervention.description: MRI scan(s) for no longer than 60 minutes
intervention.arm_group_label: Safety of a Customized NICU MRI System

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Any infant admitted to the NICU at CCHMC
- Medically stable as per the opinion of the attending neonatologist currently on service
- Parental consent obtained
Exclusion Criteria:
- Infants too large to fit in the customized NICU MRI system comfortably (expected to be infants >4.5 kg)
- Standard MRI exclusion criteria as set forth by the CCHMC Division of Radiology

facility.name: NICU, Cincinnati Children's Hospital Medical Center

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Patients, eligible to participate, were recruited from within the NICU beginning in February 2012 ending in April 2012.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: All participants enrolled in the study, completed the study.

group.title: Pilot Group
group.description: Patients who had an MRI in the NICU scanner.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events as Measured by Vital Signs, Change in Temperature, and Physical Exam
outcome.description: Heart rate and oxygen saturation will be measured every 15+/- 5 minutes. The infants' temperatures will be taken immediately before the MRI and again immediately after the MRI. A physical exam will be performed both immediately before and immediately after the MRI to assess for any physical changes.

group.title: Pilot Group
group.description: Patients who received an MRI on the NICU scanner.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events as Measured by Vital Signs, Change in Temperature, and Physical Exam
measure.description: Heart rate and oxygen saturation will be measured every 15+/- 5 minutes. The infants' temperatures will be taken immediately before the MRI and again immediately after the MRI. A physical exam will be performed both immediately before and immediately after the MRI to assess for any physical changes.

outcome.title: MRI Image Quality
outcome.description: The following measures will be individually evaluated and compared to similar images previously acquired on an adult scanner: Overall Study Quality, Motion, Spatial Resolution, Signal to Noise, and Contrast.
outcome.time_frame: Post MRI Scan for Each Infant
outcome.population: Number of NICU MRI Images with Equal or Better Quality than Adult Scanner Images

group.title: Pilot Group
group.description: Patients who had an MRI on the NICU scanner.

measure.title: MRI Image Quality
measure.description: The following measures will be individually evaluated and compared to similar images previously acquired on an adult scanner: Overall Study Quality, Motion, Spatial Resolution, Signal to Noise, and Contrast.
measure.population: Number of NICU MRI Images with Equal or Better Quality than Adult Scanner Images

reported_events.time_frame: Patients were monitored for approximately 2 hours after the MRI for Adverse Events for skin changes due to the monitor leads.
reported_events.desc: Patients' vital signs (heart rate and oxygen saturation) were measured and recorded during the MRI. The physician present performed a physical exam immediately after the MRI to assess for any skin changes due to the MRI scan process.

group.title: Pilot Group
group.description: Patients who had an MRI in the NICU scanner.

event.description: One baby had a drop in heart rate for about 5 seconds.
Baby had a mild desaturation for about 5 seconds. It was unrelated to the study.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
